configuration.note: All activation evaluations use Neuronpedia API. Activation threshold is dynamically calculated from top 10 high-activating API exemplars (average of max activations / 2). Generation Evaluation uses top 10 high-activating exemplars. Prediction Evaluation uses selected exemplars directly from API (excluding top 10), with activation values already available (no API calls needed for activations). model_name and sae_path are kept for record-keeping only and are not used for any calculations.

explanation.description: Feature 15411 (Layer 7) detects English perfect-construction polarity/experiential adverbs, strongly preferring ' never' in declarative perfects and modestly activating on ' ever' in interrogative perfects. Across tests, ' never' in perfect contexts activates ~3.0469–3.7344, while ' ever' in interrogative perfects activates ~0.6953–2.2500; present perfect without these adverbs and non-perfect/idiomatic uses of 'ever/never' are near-zero (0.0000–0.1670). No evidence of lexical activation for 'ever/never' outside perfect constructions; substrings ('Everyone', 'Forever') do not activate.
explanation.evidence:
- Test 1: 'Have you ever tried sushi?' → activation 2.2500 on ' ever' (supports H1/H4)
- Test 2: 'It was ever so quiet.' → max 0.1670 on 'It'; ' ever'=0.0000 (supports H2 refuted)
- Test 3: 'I have seen it already.' → max 0.0527 (supports H3)
- Test 4: 'Has she ever considered switching careers?' → ' ever'=0.7500 (supports H4)
- Test 5: "I've never been to Paris." → ' never'=3.2969 (supports H1)
- Test 6: 'Have they ever visited Rome?' → ' ever'=1.3438 (supports H4)
- Test 8: 'We have never met.' → ' never'=3.3750 (supports H1/H4 comparison)
- Test 9: 'Have I ever told you?' → ' ever'=0.6953 (supports H4)
- Test 10: 'Ever since we met.' → 'Ever'=0.0537 (supports H2 refuted)
- Test 11: 'Everyone was ready.' → 0.0000 (supports H3 substring control)
- Test 12: 'Forever is enough.' → 0.0000 (supports H3 substring control)
- Test 14: 'She has never tried.' → ' never'=3.0469 (supports H1)
- Test 15: 'I have never, ever tried.' → ' never'=3.7344; ' ever'=0.0000 (supports H1; shows preference for ' never')
- Test 17: 'Do you ever go?' → ' ever'=0.0000 (supports H2 refuted; non-perfect interrogative)
- Test 18: 'Has he ever been there?' → ' ever'=1.5469 (supports H4)
- Test 19: 'I had never seen it.' → ' never'=3.2969 (supports H1; past perfect)
- Test 20: 'He has never once lied.' → ' never'=3.5469 (supports H1)
- Test 22: 'It hardly ever rains.' → max 0.1670 on 'It'; ' ever'=0.0000 (supports H2 refuted)
- Test 24: "Haven't you ever tried?" → ' ever'=1.5391 (supports H4; contraction robust)

labels.text: English perfect-construction polarity/experiential adverbs: strong on ' never' (declarative perfect), modest on ' ever' (interrogative perfect); near-zero outside perfect or in substrings

explanation.label1: English perfect-construction polarity/experiential adverbs: strong on ' never' (declarative perfect), modest on ' ever' (interrogative perfect); near-zero outside perfect or in substrings

generated_examples: I have never seen such a bright comet before.
She has never been to Paris in her life.
They have never trusted that broker after the scandal.
He had never heard that song until last night.
We have never experienced a storm like this.
The team has never won a championship at home.
I have never felt so relieved after an interview.
The chef had never cooked with saffron before today.
Have you ever tried bouldering in the mountains?
Has anyone ever encountered such a baffling error before?

explanation.description: expressions indicating whether something has ever occurred or not, especially lifetime-experience questions and negations.
expressions indicating whether something has ever occurred or not, especially lifetime-experience questions and negations.

generated_examples: Have you ever traveled outside your home country?
I've never tasted durian in my life.
Has she ever seen the Northern Lights?
No one has ever explained that rule to me.
Not once have we ever missed a mortgage payment.
Have they ever considered adopting an older dog?
He has never, ever apologized for that mistake.
Has it ever occurred to you to call ahead?
Nobody has ever been allowed in this room.
I haven't ever won a game of chess.

prediction_evaluation.note: Prediction Evaluation uses selected exemplars directly from API (excluding top 10 used for Generation Evaluation). Exemplars are categorized into high, medium, and low activation groups from remaining exemplars, and randomly selected from each group. Activation values are already available from exemplars, so no API calls are needed to get activations. This avoids bias from explanation text and ensures diverse activation levels in evaluation examples.
